parent_protocols.title: Mouse Pancreas Dissection and Fixation for Cryosectioning

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6eem0","text":"Gather reagents for immunostaining, noting that steps 9-11, 15, and 17-18 can be performed in Kartell staining chambers (each holds ~50 mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dub69","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"pfib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":123}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"34r0e","text":"Always use freshly-made antibody and wash buffers (steps 4, 6); other reagents can be prepared ahead of time and stored at  .","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"D59AD7E0523211ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10},"mutability":"","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2bhee","text":"Acquire images of stained pancreas sections using a high-resolution whole slide scanning system (Aperio ScanScope FL, Leica Biosystems). An example field of view is shown below in Figure 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":179,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bb4kv","text":"Let the frozen cryosections thaw at room temperature and air-dry for about  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"com46","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed6or","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"C7D76FFF521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1ps3","text":"To remove OCT, wash slides 3 times in 1X PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"E2F98C46521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"erpgs","text":"Permeabilize the tissue section with permeabilization solution for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"E85956D9521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g0cv","text":"Wash the sections 3 times in 1X PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"EC7000BB521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8h8bb","text":"Draw rectangles around the sections with PAP pen and let them dry for about  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"F101B988521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4viq0","text":"Block the sections with blocking buffer at room temperature for   in a humidified chamber. Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":64,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"F5545F84521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ajks2","text":"Aspirate the blocking buffer, add primary antibodies diluted in antibody buffer (see Table 1), and incubate in a humidified chamber   at  . Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with antibody solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":132,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":137,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"687v7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ks14","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar18r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"FC3F9D32521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"03DF5360523311ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"FC3FA004521B11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","height":145,"id":190058,"is_video":false,"label":"","legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":67,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aalhh","text":"Table 1: Detailed information for primary and secondary antibodies.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"Picture1.jpg","pause":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vnbnyjx.jpg","preset":["overnight"],"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vkbnyjx.jpg","start":null,"type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vmbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vjbnyjx.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hn5t","text":"Aspirate the primary antibody solution and wash the sections 3 times in wash buffer for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":72,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"0518154E521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fq9c","text":"Add secondary antibodies diluted in antibody buffer (see Table 1) and incubate for   at room temperature in a humidified chamber. Use a sufficient volume (approximately 200-300 µl) to ensure each section is entirely covered with antibody solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":5400,"guid":"09AF1343521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"97a0e","text":"Aspirate the secondary antibody solution and incubate slides in DAPI solution to counterstain for   at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"11DA20E4521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"48pit","text":"Wash slides 3 times in 1x PBS for  , decanting or switching to a new chamber after each wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"17CE3914521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j44e","text":"Add a sufficient volume of SlowFade Gold mounting medium (approximately 5-10 µl) to each tissue section, ensuring tissue section will be entirely covered after medium spreads. Carefully mount coverslips, making sure to avoid creating air bubbles between the tissue and coverslip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dst1l","text":"Blot away any excess mounting medium from slide edges and seal the coverslipped slides with nail polish on all edges. Allow slides to dry completely before imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7lcto","text":"Apply a tissue classifier algorithm (HALO® image analysis platform, Indica Labs) to quantify cross-sectional area of islet alpha (glucagon+), beta (insulin+), and delta (somatostatin+) cells. An example markup image is shown in Figure 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":228,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab7k0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47tp5","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":1,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"adjnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7arih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"531573CC521C11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","height":327.99999999999994,"id":190062,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":22,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2kg0a","text":"Figure 1 (above left). Fluorescent imaging of mouse pancreatic tissue.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":23,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"46ds6","text":"Figure 2 (above right). Analysis of mouse pancreatic islets using a tissue classifier algorithm.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","original_name":"Picture2.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vsbnyjx.jpg","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vqbnyjx.jpg","type":1,"url":"https://indicalab.com/products/tissue-classification/","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vrbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vpbnyjx.webp","width":543.3734939759036}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":48,"offset":74,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2ilru","text":"To quantify islet cell mass for a given mouse, stain and analyze at least 5 cryosections spaced approximately 200 μm apart.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2n7ac","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53keh","text":"  ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cnk46","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1jka4","text":"Each islet cell type is reported as a percentage of total alpha, beta, and delta cell area. Islet cell mass is calculated by multiplying alpha, beta, and/or delta cell area by pancreas weight.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"6F5D9A80524111ECBBA50974D2CF3B34","height":179.44164759725396,"id":190066,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":"step-4AB4FD60521C11EC84A8739F0BC5FEC7-nested-draft-adjnc","original_name":"IPA-protocols-20.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vwbnyjx.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vubnyjx.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vvbnyjx.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/f3vtbnyjx.webp","width":145.48423005565866},"mutability":"","type":"image"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0r14","text":"10% Triton X-100 stock (30 mL) – Combine 3 mL Triton-X-100 and 27 mL 1X PBS. Mix on shaker for   or until Triton X-100 is completely dissolved. Store at   for up to 1 month.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":153,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":1800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B51DFDEE523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B51DFC7E523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6k7ct","text":"Permeabilization solution (0.2% Triton, 50 mL) – Combine 1 mL 10% Triton stock and 49 mL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6deea","text":"Blocking buffer (5% Normal Donkey Serum, 4 mL) – Combine 0.2 mL NDS and 3.8 mL 1X PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8p0ci","text":"Antibody buffer (10 mL) – Combine 0.1 g BSA, 0.1 mL 10% Triton stock, and 9.8 mL 1X PBS. Filter solution through a 0.22 μm syringe filter and store at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":151,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"CBD1B915523A11ECA43B0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4vnmr","text":"DAPI staining solution (1:25,000, 50 mL) – Combine 2 µl DAPI stock (5mg/mL) and 50 mL 1X PBS. Keep protected from light or prepare right before step 17.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aif15","text":"Wash buffer (150 mL) - Combine 148.5 mL 1X PBS and 1.5 mL 10% Triton X-100 stock.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
